title: Ticket #7880: condor_chirp on windows aborts in c-rutime after successful command
description:
G-Research reports that when they upgraded to 8.8.9, condor_chirp on Windows began to exit with status -1073740791 which is STATUS_STACK_BUFFER_OVERRUN, even when the command was successful.

In attempting to reproduce the problem, I discovered that condor_chirp 8.8.7, 8.8.9 and 8.9.9 would all exit with an error status (but a different one) in the c-runtime process teardown code while trying to close open files.

This does not seem to be because anything in condor_chirp changes, but rather because Microsoft changed the c-runtime to automatically call _fcloseall() after main exits.

condor_chirp has always done something that is technically illegal - it calls fdopen twice against the same fd. This results in an error when the second FILE* is closed because the first one closed the underlying file. On Linux error is quitely ignored, and on Windows it was as well for many years, but a recenty it began to cause an abort instead. We believe that a recent update of Windows is what changed.

If we fix the underlying bug - the incorrect re-use of an fd, the abort no longer happens.
